#73 - introduce a visibility for explicitly shown form fields even if they are not actually apart of an entity definition. This ensures that fields that are created and parsed via CustomPersistence handlers (like product options) still have the ability to be shown in a form

The inspect phase of the CPH needs to also invoke the adorned persistence module so that the adorned properties can also be tacked on during the inspect phase. This should probably be refactored in future releases to support this use case better.

#186 - Rework how polymorphic filtering works.
Unfortunately, simply identifying the correct path is not sufficient
for Hibernate to generate well-formed queries. This commit reworks
that strategy to ensure that the proper roots and restrictions are
defined in these cases.

Invocation handler for unit testing byte-weaved classes. When Spring is unavailable to complete byte-weaving during unit testing, this invocation handler will invoke a chosen method against an array of Objects that are meant to be byte-weaved together. The invocation handler will return when the first object is found that can be successfully used with the chosen method.

BroadleafCommerce/BroadleafCommerce#485 - Initial commit of Payment Refactoring - decoupling Payment Modules from the framework. Only dependency now will be on common. The middleware layer is facilitated by the new DTO objects defined here.

#485 - First draft at a scorched-earth approach to the payment refactoring from the framework domain side. Represents work in progress and later revisions might be undo some of this invasiveness. This is a very large commit so read on for more detail
- PaymentInfo has been renamed to OrderPayment
- PaymentInfoDetail has been renamed to PaymentTransaction
- Payment workflows have completely gone away and thus the application of payments to an order has been decoupled from invoking checkout
- Better javadocs across all of the payment domain (although by no means are complete)
- Deprecate/remove any baked-in dependency on anything that implements Referenced. Use of entities implementing this interface should be treated as an edge-case rather than the common case
- Move the Referenced entity into their own packages
#485 - Remove unnecessary methods that are unused now that payment modules have gone away
#485 - Remove already-commented out AOP xml config, move the AOP transaction config for blSecurePU down to @Transactional annotations
#485 - Add a rawResponse to PaymentTransaction
#485 - Update some comments in the common payment DTOs, add stub implementation of blPaymentGatewayGatewayCheckoutService
#485 #408 - Allow payments and payment transactions to be soft-deleted
#485 - Remove the PaymentResponseItem entity. Functionality should actually be eclipse by that of the PaymentTransaction
#485 - Complete most of the stubbing for converting a payment response DTO into a payment and transaction to add to the order

#485 - Refactor the payment checkout service to return primitives to not have to deal with nulls, add a new configuration to deal with payment gateways supporting multiple payments with the same payment type in an order, enhance some docs across some payment services
#485 - Update docs for payment checkout service, implement looking up an order by id from a payment response in the framework payment gateway service
#485 - Move some of the payment type enums into common so that they can be referenced by payment gateways

Fixes #58 - Do not explicitly add the persistenceUnitRootURL of a PersistenceUnit to null and add the URL to that persistence units jar files. Hibernates Ejb3Configuration scans both locations automatically anyway, and if the persistence unit root URL is null then Hibernate logs a message at the error level. Also, URLs can only be scanned once. They should not occur in both the list of jars for that persistence unit AND as the root URL

Allows for smaller SOLR index when using locales that share a language.    Before, if an installation had locales for "en", "en_US", and "en_UK" all translatable fields would be indexed for all three of these locales.    The `Locale.getUseCountryInSearchIndex()` can be set to true if this behavior is still desired.   Otherwise, all three of these Locales will be indexed as "en".   Addresses enhancement #62.

Rather than just a boolean on a transaction, an initial transaction is created with a type of UNCONFIRMED. Then in the confirm activity within the checkout workflow, all of the unconfirmed transactions are confirmed, which then allows another transaction to come in as the real authorize or authorize and capture.

#650. Changed the entire customer service to use encodePassword, rather
than each method individually invoking the passwordEncoder and
determining their own salt.

#652. Have a situation where the salt that is generated is random and
stored with the hashed password.  In this case, next time a call to
encodePassword is used a new salt is generated and the password does not
match. Instead, I added a method to customer service called
isPasswordValid that delegates to the underlying passwordEncoder to
validate the password. This is superior to encoding the password
yourself and checking if it is valid. Because in the case with a
randomly generated salt, it will never be.

#650. Changed the entire customer service to use encodePassword, rather

(cherry picked from commit d033fea40e0690d9b211d2b1e15f07e1857eef4c)

#652. Have a situation where the salt that is generated is random and stored with the hashed password.  In this case, next time a call to encodePassword is used a new salt is generated and the password does not match. Instead, I added a method to customer service called isPasswordValid that delegates to the underlying passwordEncoder to validate the password. This is superior to encoding the password yourself and checking if it is valid. Because in the case with a randomly generated salt, it will never be.

#424. Fixed an issue where a user may have gone to a secure page, and
then tried to go to a unsecured page.  They never go back to non-SSL.
The reason is that the line "!invocation.getHttpRequest().isSecure()"
returns false if the SSL terminated at the LB.  Now, in this case, we
need to key, first off of the X-Forwarded-Proto header to see if this is
SSL.  If so, we can redirect to non-ssl.

Fixes #736 - Fix an issue where filtering by a date and then sorting caused an exception
The real cause here is that when the criteria inputs were updated with the URL parameters, we were just parsing out the parameters into a JSON object (via BLCAdmin.history.getUrlParameters()) but forgetting that the parameter values themselves could be URI-encoded. This led itself to dates only, because date filter values have a space in them (yyyy.mm.dd HH:MM:SS). The criteria value was getting overwritten with yyyy.mm.dd%20HH:MM:SS and then when we attempted to sort that, the final value for the criteria ended up being yyyy.mm.dd%2520HH:MM:SS in order to encode the '%' sign.

Fixes #736 - Fix an issue where filtering by a date and then sorting caused an exception
The real cause here is that when the criteria inputs were updated with the URL parameters, we were just parsing out the parameters into a JSON object (via BLCAdmin.history.getUrlParameters()) but forgetting that the parameter values themselves could be URI-encoded. This led itself to dates only, because date filter values have a space in them (yyyy.mm.dd HH:MM:SS). The criteria value was getting overwritten with yyyy.mm.dd%20HH:MM:SS and then when we attempted to sort that, the final value for the criteria ended up being yyyy.mm.dd%2520HH:MM:SS in order to encode the '%' sign.

#775 - Massive refactoring in order to support i18n enhancements. Refactored Address and deprecated dependency on BLC_COUNTRY and BLC_STATE. The Country entity should now be used only for lookups/filtering. The State entity has been deprecated in favor of a CountrySubdivision, which better models international Country principal subdivisions. Billing/Shipping Addresses can now be international based on the ISOCountry and a stateProvinceRegion subdivision and supports ISO 3166-1 and ISO 3166-2 standardization.

fixes #1119 - Remove dependency on Log4j from SupportLogger and related classes. Now, SupportLogger works independently of any logging framework. The implementation has the ability to switch out adapters that specify how a message is emitted. The default adapter (SystemSupportLoggerAdapter) will emit messages to `System.out` by default The implementations can be configured via system property if necessary. A Disable adapter (which ignores calls to support logger) as well as an SLF4J adapter (which delegates to an underlying logging framework) are also provided.

#935 - A "SectionCrumb" in open admin has a sectionIdentifier that is translated into a class.    Generally this is a one to one concern but in some cases, we may want multiple sectionIdentifiers to utilize the same underlying class.    A good example might be to separate admin menus for Carts and Orders which both use the same underlying entity.     Allowing an "originalSectionIdentifier" provides a quick hack to support this.    A better solution might be to use the term sectionClass instead of sectionIdentifier for the most common usage scenarios.

issue #57
Fixes #1356.

For #1357.    In BroadleafCurrencyUtils, the system makes frequent calls to this map (each time a price is displayed which could be 100s of times per request).     It is desirable to avoid the synchronization call in this case.

Since most implementations use exactly one currency format, using a synchronized LRUMap is overkill.    Changing this structure to use a ConcurrentHashMap as even in very extreme cases, we would only expect the total number of formats to be added to this map to be in the hundreds.

Addresses #1357
- Change LRUMaps where normal usage should be within the upper limit to use an EfficientLRUMap (new class that starts with a ConcurrentHashMap and then uses a synchronized LRUMap only if necessary)
- For LRUMaps that use the pattern `if (! map.contains(key)) ... `, refactor to avoid potential race condition that the key you want is evicted by another thread before "get" is called.
- Remove embedded synchronization blocks in EXPRESSION_CACHE objects frequently used in rule builder code in favor of the EfficientLRUMap
issue #57, add logic to generate different success/decline types according to the payment amount
issue #57 generalize rollback handler, use specific seed types for both Checkout and SubscriptionPayment

QA#764 - Add property to not return the default value for a translated field if that value is not in the same language.
Instead, return blank.   The new property to drive this behavior is named "returnBlankTranslationForNotDefaultLocale".

This ticket also provides an overridable method in TranslationServiceImpl to exclude some fields from this logic.     In particular, the CMS lookup fields (which start with pageTemplate) needed to be excluded for the home page to render in heat-clinic.     This is because all page template fields currently go through translation provider (even fields like ID) which are not even translatable.

Check property flag to determine if new Sitemap.xml should be generated after timeout.

The default implementation will first check local resources and then retrieve from file system if timeout is expired. In the default implementation; the only way to generate a new sitemap.xml once it has been created is to delete the current sitemap.xml from the file system. This new flag will provide an option to override that behavior and allow a new sitemap.xml to be created after timeout instead of returning an old (potentially outdated) sitemap.xml from the file system.

BroadleafCommerce/QA#2011 - Fixed failure to use correct cache key
Previously, the cache key was set as `"SC|" + sc.getId()` when an SC item DTO was added to the cache.
However, when the remove method was called when the cache was invalidated, the buildNameKey method was used,
which built the key very differently. Also, the way which site was in use for the SC item was inconsistent
with how it is determined elsewhere.

- Key now always set using key builder methods
- Use the request context to find the site instead of the SC item, because the latter resulted in incorrect keys being set initially
- Added boolean for "secure" to key builders
- Refactored `removeStrcucturedContentFromCache` to retry on failed removal and check if the sandbox was `null` when the item was originally added to the cache.
- Deprecated `removeItemFromCache` in favor of `removeItemFromCacheByKey` to reduce duplicate code
- Deprecated `buildTypeKey` in favor of `buildTypeKeyWithSecure`

BroadleafCommerce/QA#1880 - Added ESAPI properties and POM dependencies

BroadleafCommerce/QA#1880 - Created url validation util method
This method invokes `org.owasp.esapi.Validator#isValidRedirectLocation` to provide validation of URL redirects. The ESAPI method only works with relative URLs; therefore, the `validateUrl` method strips the scheme, server name, and port (if applicable) from the URL before validating. This method throws and `IOException` if the URL does not pass validation. Originally, this would encode the URL; however, you cannot encode a full or relative URL without getting an invalid URL. Encoding is for parameters.
BroadleafCommerce/QA#1880 - Updated ESAPI properties with site name (admin) instead of "test"

BroadleafCommerce/QA#1880 - Made use of `validateUrl` util method when using Spring security `redirectStrategies`.
This is because there is not an ESAPI analogue to `sendRedirect(HttpServletRequest request, HttpServletResponse response, String url)`. Otherwise, `org.owasp.esapi.HttpUtilities.sendRedirect()` would be used.
In the case of a bad redirect, a 403 error is sent.
BroadleafCommerce/QA#1880 - Replaced encoding of URLs with sending them via ESAPI's HttpUtilities.
BroadleafCommerce/QA#1880 - Updated redirect validation regex so it does not invalidate /login.* or /

BroadleafCommerce/QA#1880 - Cannot use ESAPI in these cases (and Veracode does not list them).
Because these can redirect to successUrl or failureUrl, depending on the context from which you reach the login page, you would need to have a list of all valid URLs instead of using regex. We already clean and validate the params in these cases as well.
BroadleafCommerce/QA#1880 - Another place that should not use ESAPI and is not listed by Veracode in any case.
BroadleafCommerce/QA#1878 - Removed POM dependency on ESAPI making this issue dependent on BroadleafCommerce/QA#1880

BroadleafCommerce/QA#1880 - Validate URL and param without ESAPI
When switching between sandboxes, ESAPI would throw a validation error for the redirect produced because it is not subordinate to `/admin` or `/login`, and ESAPI does not let you use a full URL to validate redirects, only relative URLs. Therefore, I moved away from ESAPI in this instance.

Instead, I take the request base URL and compare that to the site base url to make sure they are the same. We do not want to be redirected to some other domain or a malicious page. (By default, when you change sandboxes, you are sent back to the index page (i.e., `/`).) If not valid, then it is a security error. After that check, if the URL param "blSandboxId" is present, we check to make sure that the sandbox it references actually exists. We also ignore all other parameters, because there should not be any.

BroadleafCommerce/QA#1944 - With spring 4.2, there appears to be a problem with timing of entity manager information and beans that implement ApplicationListener. As a result, beans that need to setup a broadleaf transaction util in an ApplicationListener class have the potential for some problems. We address by implementing SmartLifeCycle instead, which is preferred anyway for the type of bean lifecycle management we're trying to achieve. This commit also cleans up the Spring dependency injection in general for jobs and events.

BroadleafCommerce/QA#1944 - Update tests to work with the removal of the MergeXmlWebApplicationContext

BroadleafCommerce/QA#1944 - Fix an issue where properties are not registered in all dependent properties prior to instantiation

In this case, this was caused by the order property not being set in the ValidateAndConfirmPaymentsActivity until _after_ the BaseProcessor (specifically the blCheckoutWorkflow) was already instantiated and its lifecycle methods executed. This resulted in the ValidateAndConfirmPaymentsActivity to have the wrong order in the final list of blCheckoutActivities.

Since we are sorting the list of activities in afterPropertiesSet() and since there is no 'real' dependency beans on the activities already being created, sorting of the activities list was moved to after spring's ApplicationContext completes refreshing which means all beans will have been instantiated and set

#850 - Rewrite the Broadleaf property configurations to utilize an ApplicationListener and spring.factories entries

The main reason to do this is because registering PropertySources with a BeanFactoryPostProcessor means that we cannot use these properties to drive @ConditionalOnProperty, since they weren't registered early enough. An ApplicationListener is activated immediately after the ApplicationContext has been created and it is a well-defined hookpoint in various places within Spring.

This did require some changes in how we do test configuration (since we
need eo specify the initializerClasses now in the
@ContextConfiguration). This also means that since @PropertySource
annotations are not determined until the ConfigurationClassParser runs
the framework properties will take precedence over any properties
defined there. If someone is using Spring Boot though, anything in
application.properties overrides any of the Broadleaf properties.

Since this is the case, I have also changed how the PropertySources are
registered within the Spring Environment. Previously every
PropertySource from the framework or profile was registered individually
in the Environment. This is now a CompositePropertySource for profile
and framework properties so that you can reorder or change all of them
as a single unit.

This adds some exploratory testing to validate the above assumptions of
how things work.

Shore up integration testing configuration (#869)

This adds a few new annotations that can be used for integration tests in TestNG, JUnit and Spock contexts. This also greatly simplifies the configuration between the 3 since they now all can depend on the same base annotations rather than copy/pasting the same configuration around to the different scenarios. For JUnit specifically, we have removed the base classes and instead rely on annotation composition. If a particular user decides to extend from one of the Spring base classes then they can but it is no longer required. TestNG tests still require extension from one of the Broadleaf base classes because they are tied to the Spring TestNG class hierarchy. However, this is now split between transactional and non-default-transactional tests
#869 - Remove the unnecessary JUnit annotations since @RunWith cannot be apart of a meta-annotation. Add example tests for Spock and JUnit and update documentation

ListGrid Enhancements

Merge pull request #957 from BroadleafCommerce/qa-2797-retry-5.2

ListGrid Enhancements

Retrieved the SKU entity instead of just the ID because we need to manually filter out archived SKUs before returning their IDs.

The normal filters that would handle this automagically for queries only apply to the root entity (SkuProductOptionValueXref here). However, for MT cases, we also need to manually make sure that the SKU doesn't have a local override that's archived. Thus, by retrieving the entity instead of the ID, we'll get the entity that's already been transformed to the correct sandbox version for the current site, and we can check that for archived status before returning the correct IDs.

see BroadleafCommerce/QA#2825

BroadleafCommerce/QA#2760 - Support default listgrid search prompt for specific entity patterns. In some cases, this can save time retrieving a page of default records that are essentially throw-away if the user is likely to search anyway.
BroadleafCommerce/QA#2760 - clean up
Adding annotation composition compatibility to @ConditionalOnBroadleafModule annotation. (#963)

Always add the runtime.environment property to the list of active Spring environments (#964)

In 5.2.0-RC1 and below the runtime.environment was only added to the list of active profiles if it was already empty. However there could be scenarios in which a user was using the deprecated Broadleaf environment key and Spring Profiles for some other functionality. We'll still output the warning but don't want to break functionality for older users.

Added new cache to store dates by URI for when queries are made when looking up a Page by URI.

This will reduce the number of queries made in this context from 1 per URI per 10 minutes, to 1 per URI per day, unless the cmsPageCache is invalidated due to sandbox changes.

`findPageBy()` looks up pages that are active and online at the **date** of the request (the **date** is cached for 10 minutes). These changes will change that interval to **1 day** and account for potential cache invalidations due to changes to the production page (deploys) by checking the **cmsPageCache** before checking the query date cache. The new method, `findPageByURIAndActiveDate()`, retrieves Pages that are active at the time of the cached date and up to a day later. Because we cache the query for a day, we need to retrieve all pages that will be active any time during that interval even if they aren't active for the entire interval. Therefore, we then need to manually remove any pages that aren't active right now.

see BroadleafCommerce/QA#2727

This was done to support versions of Tomcat 7 (and perhaps other servlet containers) whose ServletContextInitializer scanning loads and then caches classes prior to Broadleaf adding requisite class transformers. If this scanning needs to be disabled for this reason, you have to bootstrap from a web.xml. This is the simplest configuration that plays nicely with how Spring Boot would normally bootstrap the application via a ServletContextInitializer

#978 - Update the Validator API to the latest JSR version supported by Spring 4.1, remove unused validator annotation processing

The reason this was updated in the first place was in order to support the usage of @EnableConfigurationProperties in non-boot projects where a Validator provider is required. This was moved to common so that it is contributed for both site and admin. The upgrade to the latest version happened after incompatibilities discovered between older versions of validator and spring boot

#978 - Add a standardized way to initialize @Configuration classes to come after any Boot AutoConfiguration classes

The original intent of this is to support both the presence and absence of @EnableAutoConfiguration classess at the same time. There are some instances in Broadleaf where we need defaults when Spring Boot is not present, but if boot IS present, we want to delegate to whatever the boot AutoConfiguration is (assuming it is activated). With these constructs, it allows us to safely use @ConditionalOnMissingBean that depends on bean definitions that are originally contributed from boot @EnableAutoConfiguration classes

#978 - Allow our overridden AdminRequestMappingHandlerMapping to operate with or without the presence of Spring boot web autoconfiguration, allowing us to keep all the useful autoconfiguration defaults
#978 - Ensure that the admin upload multipart configuration works with and without the presence of Spring's MultipartAutoConfiguration

Merge pull request #978 from BroadleafCommerce/autoconfiguration-support

Upgraded Log4J dependency and references to Log4J2 and made the dependency optional (#1638)

* Upgraded dependency on log4j to log4j2.

* Deprecated `RuntimeLog4jCofigurer` since log4j is not the default logger and this class was intended for internal use.

* Update javadoc to use logback as the example of a rolling daily log instead of log4j

* Make the log4j2 dependency optional and leave log4j in the PomEvaluator.
Added license to CheckoutPaymentInfoFormValidator

* Switched from Log4J to JUL so as to be able to remove `log4j.properties` from project. Also, had to exclude Log4j from ESAPI dependency because HSQLDB will auto-configure itself to use Log4j if found on the classpath.

* Instead of forcing an upgrade to log4j2, deprecate log4j 1 classes and create log4j 2 versions

Delegate to the Spring Boot default multipart limits for file uploads (#1846)

Spring boot uses the spring.http.multipart.max-file-size property to configure file upload size in the DispatcherServlet. If this limit is not set, then there is no hope for the admin asset uploads to ever get to the underlying storage service in the first place. Thus, for general asset uploads, it does not make sense to require an _additional_ property for asset.server.max.uploadable.file.size (which is Broadleaf-specific) be set to to further enforce these upload limits.

For backwards compatibility, if this asset.server.max.uploadable.file.size is found to be set in the environment (via properties file or other means), we will use it both within the StaticAssetStorageService as well as when we create the MultipartConfigElement to restrict asset upload sizes. This has been removed from the Broadleaf properties files to allow for null checks for determining if the property was actually set by a user or not.

Related to #1831 which kicked off the majority of these changes to begin with.

BroadleafCommerce/QA#2948 - Clone policy is required fro the structured content field

Since we programmatically modify some of the ToOne properties on the StructuredContentFieldXref to the StructuredContentField entity, we must indicate to Broadleaf that it should be cloned. If not, this fails silently and simply does not process any of the fields we set on the StructuredContentField at all.

In order to expose these fields to populate in the first place, we need to have populateToOneFields set to true

#1799 Use the populateValueRequest requestedValue instead of the property value. These values are rarely different but in the case that the map field is a boolean and the property value is null then the requestedValue will be false.

If property value is used instead of requested value in that situation and it's during an enterprise pre-add then the following operations to delete the ValueAssignable will fail since it doesn't exist yet.

Always keep translations disabled on adds (#1878)

This behavior went through a few different changes. First, we conditionally disabled translations on add in BroadleafCommerce/BroadleafCommercePrivate#908. Then, we realized that even on edits it was possible to click the translations link too quickly and get a display without some styling. This was "fixed" in BroadleafCommerce/BroadleafCommercePrivate/pull/919. However, that essentially reverts the change in BroadleafCommerce/BroadleafCommercePrivate#908 because now _all_ translation links get un-disabled, no matter if they are on the 'Add' or 'Edit'. Finally, this underwent another change to work with modals in #1828.

This PR basically re-fixes the original BroadleafCommerce/BroadleafCommercePrivate#908 change to only activate translations if there is a backing id, which usually is in the case of an edit. This also includes a helpful message to indicate why the translations link is disabled.

#1887 - Remove SessionFactory usage in admin persistence code for mapped properties

This also removes our need to prevent Spring from managing the connection for us, and our custom code to tell Spring how to Proxy the entity manager. If we were to leave the proxy implementations in, all attempts to start a transaction in the admin would fail with a reflection exception 'Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: object is not an instance of declaring class'. This is because the Proxies that Spring creates for the EntityManager does not implement _all_ the ones that the default Hibernate Session does (since now in Hibernate 5.2 SessionImpl implements the entire JPA spec itself)

The SessionFactory retrieval code failed when attempting to unwrap the Session and retrieve the SessionFactory early on (specifically, instantiation of RuleBuilderServices in the admin) then we would always get a 'No Transactional EntityManager available', possibly because Spring has not injected it early enough, through an @PersistenceContext.

Since we have all of the Hibernate mapping data via PersistentClass statically anyway, it makes more sense to simply leverage than than rely on deprecated methods in SessionFactory

Introduced a severity-critical bug (BroadleafCommerce/QA#3394)

fix: Overrode default Hibernate naming strategies

Added properties to override the default Hibernate naming strategies to fix inconsistencies introduced with upgrade from Hibernate 4 to 5. By default, Broadleaf will use the legacy implicit naming strategy to ensure clients are not impacted until they can make the necessary changes.

Before the upgrade:

```
// from PageImpl
@JoinTable(name = "BLC_PAGE_RULE_MAP",
           inverseJoinColumns = @JoinColumn(name = "PAGE_RULE_ID", referencedColumnName = "PAGE_RULE_ID"))
```

would product the column name (for the join column) `BLC_PAGE_PAGE_ID`.
After the upgrade the name would be `PageImpl_PAGE_ID`.

See https://github.com/hibernate/hibernate-orm/blob/5.0/migration-guide.adoc#naming-strategies for Hibernate's migration guide
See https://docs.jboss.org/hibernate/orm/5.1/userguide/html_single/chapters/domain/naming.html for more details about Hibernate naming strategies

code review enhancements

BroadleafCommerce/BroadleafCommerce#performance_improvements
code review enhancements

Updated EntityDuplicator domain to be more generic and extinsible (#1952)

* Updated EntityDuplicator domain to be more generic and extinsible

- Moved "add duplicate button" logic from offer controller to the FormBuilderService so that it can be added to any entity form in the admin
- Used "add" row level security to control whether the button is allowed to show
- Moved "duplicate" endpoint out of offer controller into AdminBasicEntityController so that it can be used for any entity
- Migrated purpose of EntityDuplicateModifier to EntityDuplicationHelper and added additional capabilities
    - EntityDuplicationHelper must be implemented to enable duplication of a particular entity see OfferDuplicateModifier
    - CopyHints moved from loose collection to be a field of EntityDuplicationHelper
    - Added list bean "blEntityDuplicationHelpers" to keep track of all EntityDuplicationHelpers rather than have them be passed into the EntityDuplicator
- Extracted duplicate logic in AdminBasicEntityController and AdminProductController into methods in the superclass
- Added EntityDuplicationHelpers for ContentItem and ContentTargeter

* Made use of superclass constant for repeated view names

* Added copy hints for ContentItem and StructuredContent

- Removed unused import
- Made copied ContetTargeters have lower priority than originals

* Fixed ContentTargeter copying with new hints

- Removed duplicate button in same places as delete button (for now)
- Fixed EntityDuplicationHelper implementation names
- Expanded EntityDuplicator javadocs
- Extracted duplicate code in AdminProductController and its superclass

* Made the default duplicated entity name suffix a system property

- `admin.entity.duplication.suffix.default`
- Default is " - Copy"

* Fixed tests and added licenses

* Removed unused call to `isNotReadOnly()`
Fixed an issue where we can not remove the item from the cart with add-ons if the add-on quantity more than 1. (#1960)

#2002 Updated DemoPostgresSingleLineSqlCommandExtractor to replace all instances of "CURRENT_TIMESTAMP" with "date_trunc('second', CURRENT_TIMESTAMP)"

This change was done because CURRENT_TIMESTAMP for Postgres inserts the time accurate up to fractions of seconds instead of full seconds. This was an issue because when a sub collection is added to an entity that is sandboxable the date field is updated somewhere in the admin pipeline and then the entity was being persisted under the assumption that no fields would be changed. Since the date field changed an error was thrown saying that a production change on a sandboxable entity attempted to be done through the admin. This solution fixes the issue since it simply truncates to extra fractions of a second off.

Broadleaf/QA#3586 Update Spring, Spring Boot, and Spring Security

- Refactored BroadleafEnvironmentConfiguringApplicationListener into a common class named BroadleafEnvironmentConfigurer
- BroadleafEnvironmentConfigurer created so that the same code could be shared between BroadleafEnvironmentConfigurtingApplicationListener and BroadleafEnvironmentConfiguringPostProcessor
- BroadleafEnvironmentConfiguringPostProcessor created so that Broadleaf properties can be loaded earlier in the application context setup
- Without BroadleafEnvironmentConfiguringPostProcessor we couldn't override the Spring Boot property spring.main.allow-bean-definition-ovveriding which in the new version of Spring Boot defaults to false but we need it to be true
- Non Spring Boot applications will still use BroadleafEnvironmentConfiguringApplicationListener via WEB.xml like they were before. Unsure if additional customizations will be need to allow bean overriding at this time

#2075 Optionally autowire the EmailServiceProducer into the EmailService so that it's easier to send async emails

Currently sending async emails is not intuitive because we create the blEmailService bean using component scanning but we don't autowire the EmailServiceProducer. This leaves implementors in an odd situation where they have to modify a singleton bean that's already been created or override the bean definition even though they're not doing anything different than out of the box outside of just setting the EmailServiceProducer which could easily be done by optionally autowiring that dependency.

#2076 Removed an unnecessary trailing forward slash to the end of the request scheme when retrieving the port for creating the reset password url

The trailing slash would effectively make the code in getResetPasswordPort always return an empty string because we check for "http" and "https" when we're always going to send "http/" or "https/" by adding the trailing forward slash to the request scheme therefore the getResetPasswordUrl would only generate a correct url if the server was running on ports 80 and/or 443.

Fixes issue where if you select an address that has a tax and then switch to an address that has a tax that the tax for the original address is still applied (#2081)

The issue was caused by the conditional checking if the tax was zero
where we would entirely skip handing any tax details. Because of this if
there was already a non-zero tax applied it wouldn't be removed when the
tax was changed to needing to be zero. The core logic around this was
moved to applyTaxFactor where now it handles looking for the case where
if a tax record is found and the tax factor to be applied is zero then
the tax record is removed from the list of tax details.

BroadleafCommerce/QA#3586 Update Hydrated cache listeners so that they're properly setup for ehcache 3. HydratedCcacheEventListenerFactory was removed as using a factory is impractical since ehcache 3 requires you to specify a class that is the listener itself and not simply a class that has a method that returns a listener. The existing hydrated cache managers have been made abstract as the concrete implementations need to either be jcache or ehcache cache event listeners. The abstract hydrated cache manager now registers itself with the HydratedSetup class as opposed to before where the HydratedSetup class requested the correct HydratedCacheManager from the factory class

Remove usage of deprecated methods (#2362)

Overhaul JCache support in order to make it easier to switch to an implementation that's not EhCache (#2363)

- Refactor ehcache xml merge into a uri provider class so that if ehcache is available we do the xml merging however if it's not available then we just return a configurable property as a URI
- Refactor the JCacheUtil into a configuration builder class so that JCache Configuration objects can be created without a depenency on the cache manager in order for its use in MergeJCacheManagerFactory
- Implement the ability to define cache regions with Java config so that Broadleaf can provide cache defaults for other cache implementations other than just ehcache
    - Supports automatically generating cache regions from java config if ehcache xml doesn't define them but they're defined in java
    - Supports overriding the ehcache xml cache regions with java config
- Added default JCache java config for known cache regions
- Added conditional annotations to automatically hook up the correct uri provider and configuration builder based on if ehcache is available on the claspath or not
- Improved the JCachePersistenceUnitPostProcessor to have the ability to override some known hibernate cache properties along with allowing for additional jcache implementation specific properties via an injected map
- Create NullSystemProperty class to use for cache missing since by default we were using a proxied implementation of SystemProperty that was serializable and would cause exception when using Redis

Remove newly added constructor requiring an environment since extensions will be using the default constructor

Decode validation string when xss protection is enabled (#2467)

* Decode validation string when xss protection is enabled

HelpScout: https://secure.helpscout.net/conversation/1392821250/44564?folderId=4164930

* Pull the environment properties out with @Value

Improve logic on building invalid product option error message

- Call StringUtil#sanitize only when productOption#getErrorMessage is empty
- Don't add productOption#getErrorMessage to log if it's empty

Update stripXSS to use ESAPI encoder()#encodeForHTML instead of validator()#getValidSafeHTML

- Replace the usage of getValidSafeHTML with encodeForHTML so that the invalid isn't removed completely. The use of getValidSafeHTML caused some valid characters to be removed, for example, if you want to allow backslash in your product option input, using getValidSafeHTML would completely remove it from the value. But with encodeForHTML it will be encoded then passed down, then later on you can decode it to compare with regex
- Check for null in customStripXss

HelpScout ticket: https://secure.helpscout.net/conversation/1392821250/44564?folderId=4164930
QA: https://github.com/BroadleafCommerce/QA/issues/4328

Update XssRequestWrapper to allow validating input with specified esapi validator type

- Add validation with ESAPI.validator().getValidInput first with specified esapi validator type, strip xss with the original logic as a fallback or when no esapi validator type is specified
- Add custom HttpParameterValue validator to allow # as well
- Update docs in validation.properties

When an offer is configured with "apply to items already on sale" = No and the salePrice + discount < retail + discount then the sale price only is getting used.  This update takes into account the "apply to items already on sale" = No when assessing the discount value.  In this case, the salePrice adjustment will always be $0.
